value:
{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.06066v1", "title": "The Quantum Double of Hopf Algebras Realized via Partial Dualization and
  the Tensor Category of Its Representations", "summary": "In this paper, we aim to study the (generalized) quantum double
$K^{\ast\mathrm{cop}}\bowtie_\sigma H$ determined by a (skew) pairing between
finite-dimensional Hopf algebras $K^{\ast\mathrm{cop}}$ and $H$, especially the
tensor category $\mathsf{Rep}(K^{\ast\mathrm{cop}}\bowtie_\sigma H)$ of its
finite-dimensional representations. Specifically, we show that
$K^{\ast\mathrm{cop}}\bowtie_\sigma H$ is a left partially dualized
(quasi-)Hopf algebra of $K^\mathrm{op}\otimes H$, and use this formulation to
establish tensor equivalences from
$\mathsf{Rep}(K^{\ast\mathrm{cop}}\bowtie_\sigma H)$ to the categories
${}^K_K\mathcal{M}^K_H$ and ${}^{K^\ast}_{K^\ast}\mathcal{M}^{H^\ast}_{K^\ast}$
of two-sided two-cosided relative Hopf modules, as well as the category
${}_H\mathfrak{YD}^K$ of relative Yetter-Drinfeld modules.", "main_category": "math.QA", "categories": "math.QA,math.CT,math.RA", "published": "2025-04-08T14:09:17Z"}
